titleStmt.title: Henry Mullins to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5530

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To the Hon Thomas E Bramlette Govenor of the State of Kentucky your Petitioner Henry Mullins of Mount Vernon P. O. Rockcastle Co Ky states that there was an indictment Pending against him for retailing ardent spirits and that he had a vaild Defense to the same that owning to the distracted state of the Country at the august term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court in the year 1862. That he has absent and judgment was taken against him by Default and that lately an Execution was issued upon the same. He asks your honor to remit his fine of twenty Dollars He is a very poor man and a strictly Loyal one as in Duty bound he will ever pray
We the undersigned Citizens of Rockcastle County Concur in the Petition of Henry Mullins and think his fine should be remitted

S. H Thompson
Provo Marshal Rock Ky
Richard Singleton
G W Roberts
S. P. Griffin
R. Southard
WM Fish C. K. R. Co Court
James G Carter
Alfred Smith C R C C
E. F. Fish
M. A. Brooks
M. J. Miller
Wm McClure S. B. C.
W R Dougherty
A. Moore county Atty
Ashley Wuirs
